electionViz 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Polls for the presidential general election

presidential.Rd

Scraped from FiveThirtyEight's website of most recent polls on July 26 2020

presidential

Source

Examples

library(ggplot2)
#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘ggplot2’
#> The following object is masked from ‘package:electionViz’:
#> 
#>     presidential
library(dplyr)
#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’:
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’:
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union

data(presidential)
presidential %>%
  filter(candidate_party %in% c("DEM", "REP")) %>%
  filter(!is.na(state)) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = end_date, y = pct)) +
    geom_point(aes(colour = candidate_party)) +
    facet_wrap(~state) +
    scale_colour_party()
#> Error: Problem with `filter()` input `..1`.
#> x object 'candidate_party' not found
#> ℹ Input `..1` is `candidate_party %in% c("DEM", "REP")`.

# national polls
presidential %>%
  filter(candidate_party %in% c("DEM", "REP")) %>%
  filter(answer %in% c("Biden", "Trump")) %>%
  filter(is.na(state)) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = end_date, y = pct,
             colour = candidate_party)) +
    geom_point(alpha = 0.3) +
    geom_smooth(se = FALSE, method="gam") +
    scale_colour_party() +
    theme(legend.position="bottom")
#> Error: Problem with `filter()` input `..1`.
#> x object 'candidate_party' not found
#> ℹ Input `..1` is `candidate_party %in% c("DEM", "REP")`.
